conditionStatement.statementValue: Pursuant to the Water Act, R.S.A. 2000, c. W-3, as amended, an Approval is issued to the Approval Holder for the following activity:
(a) placing, constructing, operating, maintaining, removing, disturbing works, in or on any land, water or water body;
(b) maintaining, removing or disturbing ground, vegetation or other material in or on any land, water or water body;
(c) altering the flow, direction of flow or level of water;
(d) changing the location of water for the purposes of removing an ice jam, drainage, flood control, erosion control or channel realignment or for a similar purpose;
(e) {{extra sub condition 1.1 e}}

All definitions from the Act and the Regulations apply except where expressly defined in this approval.
In all parts of this Approval:
(a) "Act" means the Water Act, RSA 2000, c. W-3, as amended;
(b) "Director" means an authorized employee of the Alberta Environment and Parks;
(c) "Regulations" means the regulations, as amended, enacted under the authority of the Act;
(d) "Maintenance" means the routine repair, upkeep and preservation of the activity authorized under this Approval;
(e) {{sub condition 2.1 e}}
(f) {{sub condition 2.1 f}}
(g) {{sub condition 2.1 g}}
The Approval Holder shall immediately report to the Director by telephone, any contravention of the terms and conditions of this approval at 1-780-422-4505.

The terms and conditions of this Approval are severable.  If any term or condition of this Approval is held invalid, the application of such term or condition to other circumstances and the remainder of this Approval shall not be affected thereby.
The Approval Holder shall retain a copy of this Approval at the site of the activity.

The Approval Holder shall retain a copy of:

(a) this Approval; and

(b) the plan(s)/report(s) referred to in Condition {{condition number}}

at the site of the activity at all times while conducting the activity.

The Approval Holder shall meet the:

(a) Interim Guidelines for the Disinfection of Fisheries Equipment to Reduce the Spread of Whirling Disease in Southern Alberta; or

(b) any updated guidelines or requirements set by the Province of Alberta with respect to Whirling Disease.

This Approval is appurtenant to the undertaking described as {{list activity}}, located at the legal land locations listed under Table 1 as shown in the plans submitted with the application {{optional plan list}}.
(a) The production wells in Table 1 and as described in the next Condition
(b) The points of use in Table 1 as described in the next Condition
(c) The {{Describe the Undertaking}} as described in the next Condition
The {{placemnt/constr/removal/disturb/alter}} activity authorized under this Approval shall be completed by {{completed by date}}.
The Approval Holder shall reclaim any disturbed bed and banks of the water body and areas associated with the activity to the original contours that existed prior to the commencement of the activity.
The Approval Holder shall not undertake the activity in any manner or use any material that causes or may cause an adverse effect on the aquatic environment, human health or public safety.
The Approval Holder shall not deposit any substance that will adversely affect the water body.
The Approval Holder shall not release water affected by the activity to any water body unless the quality of water is equal to or better than the quality of water in the receiving water body.
Where applicable, the Approval Holder shall only release water to a water body when the quality of water is equal to or better than the quality of water in the receiving water body.
The Approval Holder shall position the pump intake in the quifer:
(a) for confined aquifers, above the aquifer
(a) for unconfined aquifers, at a depth no greater than two-thirds of the saturated thickness of the quifer per Table 3.
Any berms, coffer dams or other isolation structures must be removed completely upon completion of the activity.
During the activity, the Approval Holder shall maintain a continuous flow of water in the water body.
During the activity, the Approval Holder shall not restrict more than 2/3 of the active channel width in the water body.

The Approval Holder shall cause any water entering a pump at the source to first pass through a fish screen, unless otherwise recommended by a qualified aquatic environmental specialist (QAES) that is onsite during the period of construction/remediation.

The Approval Holder shall ensure that all pumps are equipped with a fish screen that meets the design and installation criteria in the Freshwater Intake End-of-Pipe Fish Screen Guideline as amended from time to time (Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada, http://www.dfo-mpo.gc.ca/Library/223669.pdf).
The Approval Holder shall clean and maintain all fish screens in accordance with the criteria in the Freshwater Intake End-of-Pipe Fish Screen Guideline.
The Approval Holder shall minimize the removal or disturbance of existing bank vegetation at the site of the activity.

The Approval Holder shall ensure that natural drainage is maintained, e.g. surface runoff is diverted, around the reservoir in a manner that does not change or impact existing flow patterns downstream of the project.

The Approval Holder shall not conduct maintenance except for the following:

(a) {{allow maint. actions or as in Plan/Rep}}; and

(b) any other maintenance actions authorized in writing by the Director.
The Approval Holder shall notify the Director in writing, a minimum of {{indicate number of days}} days prior to the commencement of each maintenance event.

The Approval Holder shall not conduct activities in the water body between:

(a) {{start date (a)}} to {{end date (a)}}; and

(b) {{start date (b)}} to {{end date (b)}},

unless:

(c) the water body is dry or frozen down to the bed; or

(d) the site is isolated from the water body in accordance with the recommendations and specifications of a qualified aquatic environmental specialist (QAES) that is onsite during the period of construction/remediation.

The Director reserves the right to amend the following:

(a) maximum rate of diversion and

(b) the number, type and location of observation wells required.
On or before {{indicate date}}, the Approval Holder shall submit a Monitoring Program Proposal to the Director.
The Monitoring Program Proposal shall include, at a minimum, the following information:
(a) measurable wetland objectives for the constructed mitigation, the rationale for the objectives and proposed timelines to meet these objectives;
(b) a list of parameters to be monitored and the monitoring frequency for each;
(c) a rationale for the proposed Monitoring Program;
(d) a description of water drainage and flow patterns of the constructed wetland;
(e) identification of the boundaries for the Monitoring Program;
(f) a plan showing the location of sampling and monitoring points;
(g) a description of the monitoring, sampling and analytical procedures; and
(h) any other information requested in writing by the Director.

If the Monitoring Program Proposal is found deficient by the Director, the Approval Holder shall correct all of the deficiencies:

(a) as specified in writing by the Director; and

(b) within the time specified in writing by the Director.
The Approval Holder shall implement the Monitoring Program Proposal as authorized in writing by the Director.
The Approval Holder shall compile an Annual Monitoring Program Summary Report for each calendar year.
The Annual Monitoring Program Summary Report shall include, at a minimum, the following information:
(a) the results of the monitoring and sampling as required in the Monitoring Program Proposal;
(b) interpretation of all data collected since the last reporting period, including an assessment of any trends;
(c) an assessment of the progress toward the wetland objectives and timelines to meet these objectives
(d) any proposed modifications to the Monitoring Program Proposal, including rationale for the modifications;
(e) any other information requested in writing by the Director.

The Approval Holder shall submit an Annual Monitoring Program Summary Report to the Director:

(a) on or before February 28th of each year following the calendar year in which the information on which the report is based was collected; or

(b) within a time period specified in writing by the Director.
The Approval Holder shall when requested by the Director, at a minimum, provide the following information:
(a) equip the drainage site(s) with a cumulative meter or other device which registers the quantity of water pumped;
(b) measure the water levels while the pump is operating;
(c) obtain water samples for which a chemical analyses shall be performed that reports the following information:

(i) CHEMISTRY:

- Ammonia-Nitrogen (mg/L)
- Colour (TCU)
- Turbidity (NTU)

- Phenols (mg/L)
- pH
- Dissolved Iron (mg/L)
- Zinc (mg/L)
- Sulphide (mg/L as H2S)
- Calcium (mg/L)
- Magnesium (mg/L)
- Sodium (mg/L)
- Manganese (mg/L)
- Total Phosphorus (mg/L)
- Total Kjeldahl Nitrogen (TKN)
- Copper (mg/L)
- Arsenic (mg/L)
- Lead (mg/L)
- Mercury (mg/L)
- Fluoride (mg/L)
- Nitrite & Nitrate (mg/L as N)
- Sulphate (mg/L as SO4)
- Total Hardness (mg/L as CaCO3)
- Total Alkalinity (mg/L as CaCO3)
- Total Dissolved Solids (mg/L)
- Chloride (mg/L)

BACTERIOLOGICAL:

- Total Coliforms (mpn/100 mL)
- Fecal Coliforms (mpn/100 mL)

(these analyses will be used to determine the suitability of groundwater for human consumption)
(ii) water temperature, date, and time of sampling
(iii) date the analyses were performed
(iv) results of the analyses
(d) obtain water samples for which a chemical analyses shall be performed that reports the following information:
(i) Total Dissolved Solids, Hardness, Alkalinity, pH, Ca, Mg, Na+K, CO3,  HCO3, SO4, Cl, NO3, Fe;
(ii) water temperature, date, and time of sampling;
(iii) date the analyses were performed
(iv) results of the analyses;
(e) maintain the well(s) referenced as {{OBS xx-xx in report xxxxxxxx-Rxx}}, equip the well with an appropriate water level measuring device, and conduct water level measurements:
(i) establish {{number of wells}} permanent observation well(s) which shall be:
(A) located approximately {{from metres}} to {{to metres}} metres from the diversion site(s); and
(B) equipped with a device to allow for water level measurements to be taken;
(ii) provide to the Director, upon completion of the observation well(s), a:
(A) detailed map showing the location of the observation well(s) relative to the diversion site(s) including section boundaries; and
(B) diagram showing construction details of the observation well(s);

(f) survey (within 30 millimeters above mean sea level) the reference point for measuring water levels in any diversion site, standby or piezometer/observation well (including domestic/household wells) affected by this licence.
(g) and any other information requested by the Director.

The Approval Holder shall not conduct maintenance except for the following:

(a) {{allowable maint actions/Plan or Report}}; and

(b) any other maintenance actions authorized in writing by the Director.
The Approval Holder shall notify the Director in writing, a minimum of {{indicate number of days}} days prior to the commencement of each maintenance event.

The Director reserves the right to:

(a) amend any term or condition of the Approval;

(b) add a term or condition to the Approval; or

(c) delete a term or condition from the Approval,

based on the results of the Annual Monitoring Program Summary Report relating to (identify the activity), conducted by the Approval Holder.
The Approval Holder shall minimize: (a) siltation; and (b) erosion of the water body as a result of the activity.

The Approval Holder shall:

(a) develop a written Siltation and Erosion Control Plan prior to commencing the activity;

(b) implement the Siltation and Erosion Control Plan; and

(c) retain a copy of the Siltation and Erosion Control Plan at the site of the activity at all times while conducting the activity.

The Approval Holder shall conduct mitigation as stipulated in the plan(s)/report(s), {{be specific identifying plan/report}} dated {{indicate date}} or as otherwise authorized in writing by the Director.
The Approval Holder shall submit "as-built" plan(s) of the constructed mitigation to the Director within 6 months following completion of the construction of the mitigation.

The Director reserves the right to amend this Approval to:

(a) amend any term or condition of the Approval;

(b) add a term or condition to the Approval; or

(c) delete a term or condition from the Approval,

regarding further mitigation or compensation for the loss of wetland where, in the Director's opinion, the mitigation has not been successful.

The Approval Holder shall provide compensation for the loss of wetland as stipulated in the {{date, title of the agreement/letter}} such that the Approval Holder shall pay financial compensation in the amount of {{indicate amount}} to {{name of Wetland Restoration Agency}}.
On or before {{date}}, the Approval Holder shall provide the Director written confirmation from the {{name of Wetland Restoration Agency}}, that the compensation has been received.
The Approval Holder shall only drill exploratory shot-holes when the water body is frozen down to the bed or the water depth is less than 0.5 metres.
The Approval Holder shall plug and seal all exploratory shot-holes drilled in the water body in a manner that will prevent the mixing of groundwater and surface water.

The Approval Holder shall:

(a) remove all surplus drilling and plugging materials, including cuttings, from the water body; and

(b) dispose of all surplus drilling and plugging materials, including cuttings, at a location where they will not re-enter any water body.
The Approval Holder shall immediately, upon detection of a flowing exploratory shot-hole, plug and seal the exploratory shot-hole so as to confine the flow.

The Approval Holder shall not cut aquatic vegetation to a depth of more than 1.5 metres beneath the surface of the water body.

The Approval Holder shall:

(a) immediately remove all cut aquatic vegetation from the water body; and

(b) dispose of the cut aquatic vegetation at a location where nutrients and debris from the cut aquatic vegetation will not re-enter any water body.

The Approval Holder shall not cut the aquatic vegetation more than once per open water season.
A Certificate of Completion is not required for this activity.

On completion, partial completion of the activity, or when requested by the Director, the Approval Holder shall submit to the Director a certificate of completion which includes:

(a) a statement that the activity or that part of the activity has been completed in accordance with the approval, and

(b) any other information required by the Director.
Within {{60 or 90}} days following completion of the activity, the Approval Holder shall submit to the Director, a Certificate of Completion.

The Certificate of Completion shall include:

(a) a statement that the activity has been completed in accordance with the Approval; and

(b) any other information requested in writing by the Director.
